lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
* Main class to initialise and run the chatbot.
* Creates a Duke. Loads existing task data, or creates a file if it doesn't exist.
* Exception class to define Duke-related exceptions and handle them.
* Creates an exception with the given message.
* Class to parse user input and process it.
* Creates a Parser with the given classes.
* @param taskList Class to store and manage tasks
* @param storage Class to write task data to disk
* @param ui Class to define interface with user
public Parser(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Parses and processes the input string.
* @param input String input from the user
* @throws DukeException Duke-related exception due to erroneous inputs
public boolean processInput(String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("The description of a todo cannot be empty");
throw new DukeException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty");
throw new DukeException("The description of an event cannot be empty");
throw new DukeException("Task number cannot be empty");
throw new DukeException("Task number must be a valid integer");
throw new DukeException("Task number cannot be empty");
throw new DukeException("Task number must be a valid integer");
throw new DukeException("Search key cannot be empty");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :(");
* Class to handle storing and reading task data from the disk.
* Creates a Storage object to handle a file at the given file path.
* @param filePath Path object to the file
* Saves the task list to the file.
* @param taskList List of Task objects to write to file
* Reads task list from the file.
* @return List of strings representing the tasks
* Class to store and manage Task objects.
* Creates a TaskList from the given list of representations.
* Returns the size of the list.
* Creates a Task from the given representation and adds it to the list.
* @param line string repesentation of the Task
* Adds a Task to the list.
* @param type Task type defined by COmm
* @param done whether task has been marked done
private void addTask(String task, Commands type, String ddl, boolean done) {
* Add a Todo with the given name.
* Add a Deadline or Event with given attributes.
* @param isEvent whether Task is an Event
* @throws DukeException Duke-related exception due to erroneous inputs
public Task addTask(String taskAttr, boolean isEvent) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid description for an event. Use /at followed by date");
throw new DukeException("Invalid description for a deadline. Use /by followed by date");
* Returns array of Task description strings.
taskOutputs[0] = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* Marks the given Task as done.
* @param position position of the Task in the list, as seen by the user.
* @throws DukeException Duke-related exception due to erroneous inputs
public Task markDone(int position) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid task number provided");
* @param position position of the Task in the list, as seen by the user
* @throws DukeException Duke-related exception due to erroneous inputs
public Task deleteTask(int position) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid task number provided");
* Validates the given string as a date and converts it to a LocalDate.
* @throws DukeException Duke-related exception due to erroneous inputs
private LocalDate validateDateTime(String time) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Task date cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("Invalid date entered. Use format YYYY-MM-DD");
* Find tasks that contain the given key.
found.add("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Class to handle the interface with the user.
* Outputs the welcome message to the user.
writeOutput("Hello! I'm duke.Duke", "What can I do for you?");
* Outputs a Task being added, and the size of the list.
public void writeAdd(Task task, int size) {
writeOutput("Got it. I've added this task:", task.toString(),
String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", size));
* Outputs a Task being marked done.
writeOutput("Nice! I've marked this task as done:", "\t" + task.toString());
* Outputs a Task being deleted, and the size of the list.
public void writeDelete(Task task, int size) {
writeOutput("Noted. I've removed this task:", "\t" + task.toString(),
String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", size));
* Outputs Tasks found from a search.
* @param found string representations of Tasks found
* Formats the messages to be output.
writeOutput("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Enum to represent the different the user commands.
* Check if the given input matches the Command's command.
* @return true if input matches the command
* Creates a Deadline with the given task name and deadline.
* Returns string representation of the Deadline to store in file.
* Creates an Event with the given task name and time
* Returns string representation of the Event to store in file.
* Parent class to define a task.
* Creates a Task with the given task name.
* Returns string representation of the Task to store in file.
* Intermediate class to define Tasks with a deadline or timing.
* Creates a TaskDDL with the given task name and deadline/timing.
* Creates a Todo with the given task name.
* Returns string representation of the Todo to store in file.
Parser parser = new Parser(new TaskList(), new Storage(null), new Ui());
TaskList taskList = setup(); // 3 Tasks in list
